column2: What’s the percentage of colorblind men and women?
column7: Most colourblind people have difficulty with red-greens or blue yellows. This is why colour should not be the only way of organising content.

column2: How wide is the ideal search box?
column7: According to studies, a 27 character search box helps accommodate 90% of search queries (Jakob Nielsen).

column2: What’s the average number of items our working memory can hold?
column7: 7 ± 2 to be exact. This is why we try to keep navigation or menus under 7-9 items (George Miller).

column2: Which of the following is not a recognized reading pattern?
column7: F-Shape is for search results, Z-Shape is inherited from print and Gutenberg is the main for Web (Steven Bradley).

column4: Too many banners on a single page
column7: Banner efficiency is decreasing. More and more people are consciously or unconsciously stopping to see them.

column2: What’s the maximum number of clicks required to find info on a good Website?
column7: It’s not the number of clicks that matters, but rather how hard each click is (Steve Krug).

column3: Thinking everyone uses the Web like us
column4: Thinking that you can’t trust anyone
column5: Thinking we’re the center of the world
column6: Thinking we know better than users
column7: We tend to assume that other people use technology the way we do.

column2: Besides a movie, what is Wizard of Oz?
column7: User-based evaluation of unimplemented technology where a human or team is simulating some or all the responses of the system.

column2: Why is it harder to remove features than to add features?
column3: Losing makes us 2x as miserable as gaining
column4: Expert users love using all features
column6: People often use them in unexpected ways
column7: Loss aversion states that losing something makes us twice as miserable as gaining the same thing makes us happy.

column2: How fast should a system respond in order to feel natural?
column7: A system stops feeling responsive if it takes more than 100 milliseconds for it to respond (Jakob Nielsen).
